instruction: What metric was chosen to derive quantitative precipitation estimation (QPE) and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the FY-4A QPE algorithm is the bias score, correlation coefficient, and root-mean-square error. These metrics assess the accuracy and precision of the algorithm in estimating precipitation. 

The bias score measures the systematic overestimation or underestimation of precipitation by the algorithm. A positive bias score indicates an overestimation of precipitation, while a negative bias score indicates an underestimation. 

The correlation coefficient measures the strength and direction of the linear relationship between the estimated precipitation and the actual precipitation. A correlation coefficient of 1 indicates a perfect positive linear relationship, while a correlation coefficient of -1 indicates a perfect negative linear relationship. 

The root-mean-square error measures the average magnitude of the differences between the estimated precipitation and the actual precipitation. It provides an overall measure of the algorithm's accuracy in estimating precipitation.
